title: Chat Restriction??? Just look
body:
I got chat restricted for not doing well in a ranked game. I tried the entire time, said LITERALLY NOTHING NEGATIVE, and at the end everyone reported me and I got chat restricted. **throughout the entirety of the game**, my team was flaming me nonstop. I still did not say anything negative, nor did I flame them. I only muted 1 of them who was flaming the most of all of them. The {{champion:103}} kept saying that I was a troll account. If you're wondering what I played, I got autofilled bot so I played yasuo adc (which works). In champ select the enemy realized that and picked ashe and karma to counter it which is why I didn't do so well.

Can someone tell me what I did to deserve a chat restriction?? Here is my chat log from it:

Picture of my kda (with names colored out): https://prnt.sc/o9t3mm (had my op.gg posted before forgot that it shows other names too)

fyi, I already sent a ticket to riot but it has been 24+ hours and no reply so I'm taking it to the boards

EDIT: I got my ticket back and it says:

"This chat restriction was correctly placed on your account for negative chat behavior. I get that other players were giving you a hard time, but we have to hold each player accountable for their own behavior.

It's important to remember that there's a difference between arguing with your teammates, and disagreeing with them. We don't expect you to agree with other players all the time. That would be unrealistic. However, the difference between the two is that arguing does not provide anything constructive to the game. When players start arguing , tensions start running higher, and things are more likely to escalate. Arguing serves as the foundation of more continued negative behavior, which is why we don't want to see it in games. I know that this behavior may be seen as being minor, but it's still behavior that we administer penalties for.

I'm sorry to have to be so final, but we won't be appending this chat restriction, for any reason.


Thanks to everyone for their suggestions and honest opinions (and some for your sympathy). I'm gonna follow the advice that was given to me so as for this to not happen again. I did not expect this to get popular at all but I'm glad it did because I got some real advice.

 Thanks again, and see yall{{sticker:vlad-salute}}

Looking at the game you spend pretty much the whole time arguing with others. According to you you apparently did mute the problem player but then unmuted them once they started spam pinging you. If that's the case then why didn't you just mute their pings as well rather than unmute and argue with them? I get that you were having a bad game and were most likely feeling frustrated, and in those instances I get that it's tempting to argue back, but there was ultimately no benefit I can see from doing what you did there.

Next time if someone refuses to stop acting up in chat then mute them and don't unmute them later, even if they start spam pinging you, cause at that point they're just doing it to get on your nerves and nothing more. It's better to just focus on the game itself rather than on who can argue the best in chat.

In terms of punishment while I don't think this merits one on its own if it's a pattern of yours across multiple games then I could see how a chat restriction could be warranted. You may be able to get it overturned with the Support Ticket you filed (just be patient on that front), but in case you don't just remember: less arguing in chat and more playing the game.

Honestly, no, this didn't deserve a chat restriction, BUT I will not lie, I can tell how you got it.

Next time, don't say you will mute them, just do it. Same with reports. You didn't do it here, if I haven't misread anything, but don't call for reports, don't say they will be reported, just silently do it post-game.

I know, it sucks, because it prevents you from educating your opposite about what they exactly violated, but the thing is, if they won't listen to reason wheres any chance they will listen to you? 

I repeat: You didn't deserve the chat restrict, but I can see how you did get it.

Perhaps you should clarify that you believe the OP didn't deserve a punishment _according to the rules you wish were in place but aren't_. Seeing as how you can explain exactly what _actual_ rules they broke with the negative behavior they engaged in, they do logically deserve a punishment according to those rules. Riot goes by the rules they put in place, not the ones preferred by any given arbitrary individual player, so the negative behavior displayed in the OP's chat log got a correct punishment.

Correction: based on _your_ morals and beliefs. Since "I don't like these rules" has never been a legitimate justification to ignore rules, it's moot. OP broke Riot's behavioral guidelines by spending an entire game having a screeching match with annoying teammates. With a chat restriction, they won't be able to engage in such practices. The hope is that they learn what's expected of them and stop breaking the rules, because if they latch onto a self-centered "only the rules I like are worth following" perspective and continue to break Riot's rules on an ongoing basis, they'll end up permabanned.

And that's what the PB Board is for, not telling players who broke the rules to submit support tickets in an effort to get away with it. That doesn't do anyone any good... much like getting into a prolonged argument with trolls/griefers/flamers.

I feel as though the only "negative" thing I said was "stfu." I 100% agree now that I look at it, I should have just muted and went on with the game. Nothing besides the "stfu" was negative whatsoever. The way your comment is putting it, you're making it as if I flamed my teammates as well. The stfu was the only thing that I feel broke the behaviorial guidelines. What I was saying all throughout the game was not toxic nor was I flaming them. The entire game, most of my messages consisted of 1 single theme which was that **I understand** the whole time I was justifying their anger and I wasn't getting tilted at all. Keep in mind that 3 of my 4 other teammates were flaming me at the same time. I was stupid and decided to unmute the brand which was dumb on my part. But having 1 message that POTENTIALLY crosses the guidelines, does not make this chat restriction justified by **Riot's or my standards. **

Would also like to add that it was an IFS. A rioter didn't look at my game and think that it deserved a chat restriction. A bot saw that lots of people in the game reported me and I had also typed a lot in chat so it thought I was toxic, and gave me a chat restriction. Funny thing is that they probably reported me for "inting" and they bot's only way of punishing at that time was chat restriction when it had nothing to do with it.

The following on its own, once again, would have been okay, but it's just part of a larger argument. If you had literally only said this line during the whole match, there would be nothing to report. It's not a particularly useful thing to say, as people don't stop being upset within a single match, but it would've at least been an attempt at being positive:

> Galievor8525: ahri i understand youre upset that im not doing well and i understand

You keep telling them that you're not trolling and they will keep not believing you, just like they've been demonstrating over the match thus far, but you keep arguing:

Galievor8525: or intentionally feeding
Galievor8525: what??
Galievor8525: IM TRYNA E TO THE RAPTORS

> Galievor8525: jax has 10k ping
Galievor8525: dont say that he is just afk

> Galievor8525: i apoligize
Galievor8525: i had a bad game

Talking about who's reporting whom is never useful. I suppose they were screaming "RePoRt X fOr FeEdInG" and you felt the need to have a discussion with them about it. That's not going to be a useful discussion, because they have already made up their minds. Mute them, report for harassment, and move on.
